title: Requires employers to present substantial evidence when contesting workers' compensation claims
summary: Requires employers to present substantial evidence when contesting workers' compensation claims; directs the workers' compensation board to award a claimant legal fees, if it finds that an employer contested a claim without substantial evidence.

       AN  ACT to amend the workers' compensation law, in relation to requiring

         contesting claims

    4    (c)  If the board shall upon a hearing determine that [objections] ANY

   10  sum of three hundred dollars AND PAY THE  REASONABLE  CLAIMS  FOR  LEGAL
   11  SERVICES  INCURRED BY A CLAIMANT AS A RESULT OF THE OBJECTIONS SO INTER-
   12  POSED.
   13    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply  to  work-
